Uses of Class
model.Client

  • Packages that use Client 
    Package Description
    access  
    businessLogic  
    businessLogic.validators  
    presentation  

    • Uses of Client in access

      Methods in access that return types with arguments of type Client 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Client> ClientAccess.findClientByCity(java.lang.String city)
      This method searches the "client" table in the "ordermng.db" database for the client from the city specified in its argument.
      java.util.List<Client> ClientAccess.findClientByName(java.lang.String name)
      This method searches the "client" table in the "ordermng.db" database for the client with the name specified in its argument.

    • Uses of Client in businessLogic

      Fields in businessLogic with type parameters of type Client 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Validator<Client>> ClientBusinessLogic.validators
      The list of specific validators for this class.
      Methods in businessLogic that return Client 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Client ClientBusinessLogic.findClient(Client client)
      This method returns the exact client found in the database or null in case it is not found.
      Client ClientBusinessLogic.findClientById(int id)
      This method returns the client with the id specified as the parameter or throws an NoSuchElementException if it is not found.
      Methods in businessLogic that return types with arguments of type Client 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Client> ClientBusinessLogic.findAllClients() 
      java.util.List<Client> ClientBusinessLogic.findClientByCity(java.lang.String city)
      This method returns the client from the city specified as the parameter or null in case the client is not in the "ordermng.db" database.
      java.util.List<Client> ClientBusinessLogic.findClientByName(java.lang.String name)
      This method returns the client with the name specified as the parameter or null in case the client is not in the "ordermng.db" database.
      Methods in businessLogic with parameters of type Client 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ClientBusinessLogic.cascadeDelete(Client client)
      This method cascades the delete operation such that if a client is deleted, all the orders made by that client are deleted as well.
      void ClientBusinessLogic.cascadeUpdate(Client client)
      This method cascades the update operation such that if the id of the client given as the parameter is changed, it should change across all the orders that were made by that client.
      int ClientBusinessLogic.deleteClient(Client client)
      This method updates the "deleted" column of the client specified as the parameter to "true" or 1
      Client ClientBusinessLogic.findClient(Client client)
      This method returns the exact client found in the database or null in case it is not found.
      java.util.List<Orders> OrderBusinessLogic.findOrdersByClientId(Client client)
      This method returns a list with all the orders of the client whose id is equal to the one specified as the parameter of the method.
      int ClientBusinessLogic.insertClient(Client client)
      This method inserts a client specified as the parameter into the database and if the entry with the same name and city as the client specified in the argument was already inserted in the database.
      int ClientBusinessLogic.updateClient(Client client)
      This method updates the database at the entry specified as the parameter.

    • Uses of Client in businessLogic.validators

      Methods in businessLogic.validators with parameters of type Client 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void NameValidator.validate(Client object)
      This method checks the name of the client given as parameter, namely it checks if the name of the client is made up of letters only or contains at most two white spaces.
      void CityValidator.validate(Client object)
      This method checks the name of the city of the client given as parameter, namely it checks if the city name is made up of only letters or contains at most one dash line.

      Method used to generate the report for the table "orders".
